settings.text:
To mitigate the risks surrounding COVID-19  and incorporate opportunities that are accessible for all members of the community, all participants and event attendees are required to adhere to the policies stated
Keep in mind: All participants coming to the event will be required to bring connectivity devices such as a laptop, a webcam, and earphones.

- Participants are required to be fully vaccinated by the Hotel.
- All participants must adhere to government issued guidelines at the time of the event.
- Masks are not mandatory but EduDrift will suggest all participants to wear them outside their hotel rooms.
- Mandatory testing is not required but all participants are advised to self test prior to joining the event.

If a participant is experiencing symptoms, have COVID-19 or think they may have been exposed, the following things must be followed:
> In case the participant feels sick at the venue:
All participants must bring mandatory devices to tune into the event virtually. In case a participants feel that he/she/they has been exposed, he/she/them is advised to tune into the debating rounds virtually in their respective bedrooms.
> In case a participant is unable to attend due to Covid'19 restrictions beyond control:
Special provisions will be made for such participants to attend the event virtually. They just need Internet connectivity.

All participants are advised to observe the following practices:
- In case you feel sick, join the event from your room
- Observe hand hygiene and respiratory etiquette. Wash/ Sanitise hands wherever necessary
- Wear masks (preferably) outside your bedrooms.
- Comply with hotel staff

Learning from the past experience, in lieu of Covid 19, ABP'22 has a special refund policy set in place.


Cancellation Policy

Admission and Registration Fees are non-refundable upon confirmation

Accommodation Fees are refundable with 14 days notice before the event*

All Participants and Attendees are required to adhere to the adjusted COVID-19 capacities defined by the Indonesian Government; these capacities are subject to change. Check out the COVID travel policy to BALI.

settings.heading: Can I participate virtually?
settings.row_content: The tournament is not designed to be a virtual event. However, in case a participant gets covid he will be able to take part in the event virtually.

settings.heading: What happens if the event cannot take place due to restrictions by the Indonesian government?
settings.row_content:
If the event cannot take place in-person, EduDrift will issue a notice to inform all participants that the Asian BP will transit to 100% online.

In this instance, Asian BP Accommodation Fees will be refunded subjected to hotel policy.

Edudrift guarantees 50% refund of Asian BP Registration Fees to participants and the entire event will take place virtually.

settings.heading: Will I get a refund for my air tickets?
settings.row_content: Participants can get refunds from airlines for their air tickets subject to the carriers refund policy.

settings.text: Note: Participants must comply with all safety protocols required by host hotels and venues, regardless of what is outlined above.
